word.english: confused (when two people gave you completly opposite advice)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: shocked (when the police told you that your flat had been burgled)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: grateful (when friend helped you a lot with a problem)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: relieved (when you thought you had lost your passport but then you found it)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: disappointed (when you didn't get a present you were hoping to get)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: homesick (when you went study abroad and were missing your family)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: lonely (when you moved to a new town and didn't have any friends)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: nervous (when you were about to talk in public for first time)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: glad (when your friend tells you she has just passed her test)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: offended (when a very good friend didn't invite you to his party)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: fed up ( bored or frustrated an un happy especially with a situation which has gone on too long)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: upset (unhappy and worried / anxious)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: stunned (very suprised and unable to move or react)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: devastated (extremely upset and shocked)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: delighted (very pleased)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: exhausted (really tired)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: thrilled (very excited)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: terrified (extremely scared)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: furious (really angry)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: astonished / amazed (very surpised)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: desperate (feeling that you have no hope and are ready to do anything to change the situation you are in)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: miserable (very unhappy)
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: sick and tired = fed up
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: scared stiff = terrified
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: over the moon = very happy
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: down in the dumps = sad, depressed
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: worn out = exhausted
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings

word.english: I couldn't belive my eyes = be very suprised
word.part: New English File 4 Upper Intermediate - Unit 4 Feelings
